node.title: I Cherish This Lifeline to My Parents
node.description: Al Hirschfeld’s drawings of Stephen Sondheim’s shows were a gift.

node.title: How the Supply Chain Upheaval Became a Life-or-Death Threat
node.description: A maker of medical devices can’t keep up with customer demand as the shortage of computer chips puts it in competition with bigger companies with more clout.

node.title: China Evergrande Defaults on Its Debt, a Ratings Firm Says
node.description: Fitch’s announcement spells out a reality already accepted by investors: The company can’t pay its bills and is being restructured under Beijing’s eye.

node.title: Europe Pushes New Rules Turning Gig Workers Into Employees
node.description: A proposal with widespread political support would entitle drivers and couriers for companies like Uber to a minimum wage and legal protections.

node.title: Standing Ready in the Aftermath of Disaster
node.description: When wildfires and hurricanes affected communities, support networks jumped in for the food insecure.

node.title: New York City, Facing Housing Crisis, Targets Illegal Airbnb Owners
node.description: New legislation will require hosts of short-term rentals to register with the city — the latest move in a long battle between New York and the rental companies.

node.title: Socially Distant Wrestling: Young Athletes ‘Robbed’ by Covid Rules
node.description: High school teams with big ambitions are barred from playing in the state championships, possibly jeopardizing college scholarships.

node.title: Children, Coping With Loss, Are Pandemic’s ‘Forgotten Grievers’
node.description: A bipartisan group led by two former governors is urging President Biden to help an estimated 167,000 children who have lost parents or caregivers.

node.title: Bob Dole Was a ‘Linchpin’ in Passing the Americans With Disabilities Act
node.description: As a senator with a disability, Mr. Dole, who died this week, used his bipartisan influence to support a landmark law that held deep personal significance.

node.title: Biden Rallies Global Democracies as U.S. Hits a ‘Rough Patch’
node.description: The White House’s Summit for Democracy has drawn harsh criticism of domestic issues and questions about the guest list.

node.title: Ukraine Commanders Say a Russian Invasion Would Overwhelm Them
node.description: If Russia opts for an invasion, Ukraine’s generals say, they would have no hope of repelling it without a major infusion of military help from the West.

node.title: Progress for Saudi Women Is Uneven, Despite Cultural Changes and More Jobs
node.description: Women say Saudi Arabia has advanced significantly in just the past year, with more choices regarding work, fashion (including colored abayas) and social spaces, but restrictions remain everywhere.

node.title: New Zealand Plans to Eventually Ban All Cigarette Sales
node.description: The proposal, expected to become law next year, would raise the smoking age year by year until it covers the entire population.

node.title: As Russia's Balkan Allies Toy With War, Kosovo Banks on U.S. Protection
node.description: Kosovo is accusing Serbia and Russia of destabilizing the Western Balkans by exploiting simmering ethnic conflicts.

node.title: Donald Trump Supporters, Censored, Discovered They Didn't Need Twitter, YouTube
node.description: In this daily series, Newsweek explores the steps that led to the January 6 Capitol Riot.

node.title: Fox News Faces Discrimination Probe, Says Ex-Anchor Melissa Francis' Lawyer
node.description: The New York State Department of Labor launched a probe into Francis' claims of pay disparity and retaliation, her lawyer said.

node.title: What Caused the Fox News Christmas Tree Fire in New York?
node.description: The 49-year-old homeless man who allegedly set the tree on fire outside Fox News' headquarters has been released without bail.

node.title: Bushland razed, locals flee as fires rage through Yallingup and Margaret River wine region
node.description: More than 3,000 hectares of bushland are razed as two massive fires threaten lives and properties in Western Australia's most famous wine and surfing region.

node.title: Early exit for coal as NEM prepares for renewable future
node.description: Coal-fired power generators are expected to shut down nearly three times faster than previously anticipated and exit the NEM entirely by 2043, according to an updated plan that follows widespread consultation with the sector.

node.title: FDA OK's  first antibody drug aimed at long-term COVID-19 prevention
node.description: The AstraZeneca drug is drug for people with immunodeficiency and other serious health problems or allergies who can't get adequate protection from vaccinations.

node.title: The New Mayor’s First Appointment: Schools Chancellor
node.description: David Banks, a friend and adviser of Mayor-elect Eric Adams, created a network of all-boys schools.

node.title: Tucker Carlson Calls Fox News Tree Fire an 'Attack on Christianity'
node.description: Police said they don't believe the arson attack on the tree in Fox Square on Wednesday morning was politically motivated.

node.title: Riding his luck, David Warner laid the foundation for Travis Head’s onslaught
node.description: Australian opener David Warner was given numerous chances on his way to 94 in the first Ashes Test, but his innings provided Travis Head the perfect platform to hit England out of the game, writes Russell Jackson.

node.title: Hopes fast-tracked project will help alleviate housing shortage in Cromwell
node.description: The former gold mining town of Cromwell in Central Otago is experiencing another boom.

node.title: A Standing Army of Actors Keeps Germany’s Theaters Going
node.description: In a country where the director is king, it’s the hundreds of full-time players in the many house ensembles who have assured that the lights stayed on during the pandemic.

node.title: 'Let the doctors have a look': Kiri Allan gets all-clear after cancer treatment
node.description: Labour minister and MP Kiri Allan is using her announcement on being cancer-free to encourage others to have regular testing for different forms of cancer.

node.title: Will Ghislaine Maxwell Take the Stand in Sex-Trafficking Trial?
node.description: Veteran defense lawyers, including one who defended Kyle Rittenhouse, said the risk Ms. Maxwell would take by testifying probably outweighs any potential reward.

node.title: Bloomfield advice on prioritising Māori over 50 for vaccination not taken by govt
node.description: The Crown defended its pandemic response for Māori before the Waitangi Tribunal on Thursday, arguing that equity has been a consideration at every step.

node.title: Overseas residence application processing resumes
node.description: A High Court ruling means 4000 residents who were unable to come to New Zealand because of immigration rules can now travel here.

node.title: Parliament unanimously passes bill allowing change to birth certificates
node.description: The bill represents a victory for trans, non-binary, intersex and takatāpui people, and changes the process from a complicated one through the Family Court to a simple self-selecting administrative…
